verses.text: He that dasheth in pieces is come up before thy face: Keep the munition, watch the way, make \add thy\add* loins strong, fortify \add thy\add* power mightily.
For the \sc Lord\sc* hath turned \add away\add* the excellency of Jacob, As the excellency of Israel: For the emptiers have emptied them out, And marred their vine branches.

The shield of his mighty \add men is\add* made red, The valiant men \add are\add* in scarlet: The chariots \add shall be\add* with flaming torches in the day of his preparation, And the fir trees shall be terribly shaken.
The chariots shall rage in the streets, They shall justle one against another in the broad ways: They shall seem like torches, They shall run like the lightnings.
He shall recount his worthies: They shall stumble in their walk; They shall make haste \add to\add* the wall thereof, And the defence shall be prepared.
The gates of the rivers shall be opened, And the palace shall be dissolved.
And Huzzab shall be led away captive, she shall be brought up, And her maids \add shall\add* lead \add her\add* as \add with\add* the voice of doves, Tabring upon their breasts.
But Nineveh \add is\add* of old like a pool of water: Yet they \add shall\add* flee away. Stand, stand, \add shall they cry;\add* but none shall look back.
Take ye the spoil of silver, take the spoil of gold: For \add there is\add* none end of the store \add and\add* glory out of all the pleasant furniture.
She \add is\add* empty, and void, and waste: And the heart melteth, and the knees smite together, And much pain \add is\add* in all loins, And the faces of them all gather blackness.

Where \add is\add* the dwelling of the lions, And the feeding place of the young lions, Where the lion, \add even\add* the old lion, walked, \add And\add* the lionâ€™s whelp, and none made \add them\add* afraid?
The lion did tear in pieces enough for his whelps, And strangled for his lionesses, And filled his holes \add with\add* prey, And his dens \add with\add* ravin.

Behold, I \add am\add* against thee, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, And I will burn her chariots in the smoke, And the sword shall devour thy young lions: And I will cut off thy prey from the earth, And the voice of thy messengers shall no more be heard.
